result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Adan Perez-Garcia

Defendant Adan Perez-Garcia in court, appear in person with attorney John Stephen Joyce.  Abby Rockendorf appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Sworn as interpreter: Hilda Shymanik. Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 35, Judge Rosa. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 35.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

JusticePoint Supervision Report, filed.

Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel. This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.

No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  If electronic monitoring device is unavailable and cash bail has been paid, Defendant to remain in custody until a device becomes available.  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Adan Perez-Garcia in court with attorney Michael J Cerniglia.  Defendant Adan Perez-Garcia in custody.  Jennifer L Pickett appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Adan Perez-Garcia appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rosa, Branch 35.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor counts 3, 5, 6 and 8.  Case is adjourned to Br. PE for Branch 35. 
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Sworn as interpreter: Daniel Lopez
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
